meanings.sent1: The loud noise of the construction work was aroynting the birds from the trees.
meanings.sent2: The scarecrow was aroynting the pesky crows from the cornfield.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat seemed to be aroynting the peaceful nap of the dog.
meanings.sent4: The bright light of the flashlight aroynted the darkness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The strong wind aroynted the fallen leaves from the ground, swirling them into the air.

meanings.sent1: The teacher aroynted the students after the bell rang.
meanings.sent2: The captain aroynted the team after a tough loss.
meanings.sent3: The magician aroynted the audience with a wave of his hand.
meanings.sent4: The host aroynted the guests after a delightful evening.
meanings.sent5: The coach aroynted the player from the game due to an injury.

meanings.sent1: The king aroynted the traitor from the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The judge aroynted the criminal from the court.
meanings.sent3: The principal aroynted the troublemaker from the school.
meanings.sent4: The council aroynted the troublemaker from the village.
meanings.sent5: The leader aroynted the spy from the organization.
